## Natural history notes

Mohr's Thoroughwort (Eupatorium mohrii) is a perennial wildflower native to Florida and coastal habitats of the southeastern United States. It is most often found in pinelands and savannas. The plant emerges in spring and produces clusters of small white flowers during summer and fall.
